intro: Siphocampylus radiatus var. minor, commonly known as the lesser radiate siphocampylus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic compounds and often compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a flat-topped cluster, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species within its habitat.
